title: Layers of empathy
excerpt: Most of the time when we show empathy for others it's pretty one-dimensional.

children.text: Most of the time when we show empathy for others it's pretty one-dimensional.
"She's got to work the holiday weekend. That sucks."
We rarely think all the other experiences and feelings they'll endure.
How the cold will feel on their face. What’s it like talking to impatient customers at 7pm on a Friday. How long (or frustrating) their commute might be.
Perhaps that’s why articulating their feelings, frustrations, thoughts and opinions might be the perfect
in fabricating a little of it.
Because it doesn’t matter if you get your persona 100% accurate. Or that you literally walk a mile in their shoes.
Just that you feel what they feel, think what they think, or see the world from their point of view, if only momentarily.
